items.episodeTitle: The latest ITV News headlines - as thousands of NHS consultants go on strike
items.synopsis: Watch a short summary of today's top stories from the ITV News team.

items.episodeTitle: Thousands of senior doctors in England begin a 48-hour walkout
items.synopsis: Consultant doctors and hospital-based dentists have begun a two-day strike in England. NHS bosses have warned planned care will come to a "virtual standstill".

items.episodeTitle: Some supermarkets not displaying prices as clearly as they should, watchdog says
items.synopsis: The Competition and Markets Authority has said this could be preventing shoppers from comparing prices effectively.

items.episodeTitle: Temperatures in America's Death Valley continue to soar after one tourist dies
items.synopsis: Temperatures in Death Valley, in California have soared higher than 50C in recent days as the world struggles with record-breaking heat.

items.episodeTitle: Women's World Cup kicks off in New Zealand and Australia
items.synopsis: The opening ceremony took place in Auckland ahead of the first games. England's Lionesses will kick off their campaign on Saturday against Haiti.

items.episodeTitle: The journey of women's football: From outright ban to record Women's World Cup
items.synopsis: After their memorable win at the Euros last year, England's Lionesses have become household names - but the journey to get there hasn't been an easy one.

items.episodeTitle: How difficult is it to travel on holiday sustainably?
items.synopsis: Greenpeace are calling on the government to ban short-haul flights as southern Europe feels the scorching impact of climate change.

items.episodeTitle: 20,000 RMT members walk out in latest rail strike at start of school holidays
items.synopsis: Rail workers in the RMT union are walking out for 24-hours over pay and conditions, ahead of further strike action on the 22nd and 29th of July.

items.episodeTitle: Two people killed after gunman opened fire in Auckland, police confirm
items.synopsis: The New Zealand Prime Minister has confirmed that two people are dead after a gunman stormed a construction site. The shooter is also dead.

items.episodeTitle: Funding of monarchy recalculated after Crown Estate’s boost from wind farm deals
items.synopsis: The Sovereign Grant - used to fund the monarchy's official duties - will be 12% of the Crown Estate's net profits next year, down from 25%.

items.episodeTitle: The Rundown: ITV News' daily update for teenagers
items.synopsis: Watch a new edition of The Rundown every afternoon.

items.episodeTitle: Sunny spells and scattered showers: The latest ITV Weather
items.synopsis: Watch the latest UK forecast from the ITV Weather team.

items.episodeTitle: Watch Thursday's ITV Lunchtime News
items.synopsis: Catch up with the latest edition of ITV News.

items.episodeTitle: Famous New Zealand actor Taika Waititi looks back on All Blacks glory years
items.synopsis: It's a trip down memory lane for New Zealand actor and film director Taika Waititi, with a special mention for ITV panelist Sean Fitzpatrick!

items.episodeTitle: Barrett: We controlled the ball well against Italy
items.synopsis: New Zealand star Jordie Barrett believes his side were much improved in their clash with Italy, and says good preparation key for final game against Uruguay

items.episodeTitle: Ioane and Capuozzo combine for Italy
items.synopsis: Ange Capuozzo gives Italy a glimmer of hope with a superb try, as Italy look to get back in the game against a dominant All Blacks side

items.episodeTitle: Analysis - New Zealand run riot in the first half against Italy
items.synopsis: ITV's panel look at how New Zealand dismantled Italy, running in seven tries in a commanding first half display

items.episodeTitle: New Zealand start fast against Italy with Will Jordan try
items.synopsis: New Zealand get off to the perfect start thanks to Will Jordan's 24th Test try against Italy

items.episodeTitle: Highlights - Japan v Samoa
items.synopsis: Check out the highlights from Japan v Samoa in Pool D

items.episodeTitle: All Black's Jordie Barrett wary of Italy threat
items.synopsis: New Zealand Jordie Barrett believes Italy will pose a huge threat to New Zealand when the sides meet on Friday

items.episodeTitle: Grand Slammers - England's 2003 Rugby World Cup-winning stars train a group of prison inmates
Scotland ring the changes for Romania clash
items.synopsis: Scotland Head Coach Gregor Townsend makes 13 changes including switching out talisman Finn Russell for world cup debutant Ben Healy

items.episodeTitle: We wind back to a memorable Rugby World Cup in Japan in 2019
items.synopsis: A look back on a thrilling Rugby World Cup in Japan 2019, where South Africa came out as World Cup winners!

items.episodeTitle: Michael Leitch puts Japan in control against Samoa
items.synopsis: Japan asserted their authority in the first half as Michael Leitch finished off a smart move for The Brave Blossoms

items.episodeTitle: ITV Panel: Poor discipline Samoa's downfall
items.synopsis: ITV's panelists discuss the Japan v Samoa Pool D match, with Samoa's hopes hampered by a red card during the match

items.episodeTitle: Highlights - Uruguay v Namibia
items.synopsis: Check out the highlights from Uruguay v Namibia in Pool A
